sentence: Home improvement warehouse operator The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) on Wednesday saw its rating and price target lowered by analysts at Goldman Sachs.
The firm said it downgraded HD from "Buy" to "Neutral" while cutting its price target from $39 to $36.
That new target suggests a smaller 11% upside to the stock's Tuesday closing price of $32.47.
Goldman noted that it doesn't see much upside to the company's earnings forecasts (which are below consensus estimates), given fading cyclical tailwinds.
Shares of Home Depot ( HD ) have a 3.08% dividend yield, based on last night's closing stock price of $32.47.
The stock has technical support in the $28-$30 price area.
If the shares can firm up, we see overhead resistance around the $34-$36 price levels.
The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) is not recommended at this time, holding a Dividend.com DARSâ„¢ Rating of 3.4 out of 5 stars.
